intro: Argyrolobium aegacanthoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved silverlobed campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with branched stems and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
